metadata.title: USN-6719-2 -- util-linux vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6719-1 fixed a vulnerability in util-linux. Unfortunately, it was discovered that the fix did not fully address the issue. This update removes the setgid permission bit from the wall and write utilities.  Original advisory details:   Skyler Ferrante discovered that the util-linux wall command did not filter  escape sequences from command line arguments. A local attacker could  possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6719-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  bsdutils - 1:2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 No subscription required  util-linux-locales - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libmount1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 util-linux - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 rfkill - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libmount-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 eject - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libfdisk1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libsmartcols1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 mount - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 bsdextrautils - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libfdisk-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libsmartcols-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 uuid-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libblkid-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 fdisk - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 uuid-runtime - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libblkid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 libuuid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.4 No subscription required
